评论详情: The option to pull out pouches or leave them undetected is awesome

I bought 34 30 witch is what size  my other pants are ( carhart) after washing didn't fit so went back and got 38 30 and washed them and they fit. I wanted them to be a little  loose due to the pockets  and I have just anuff room to put 2or 3 fingers at the button  without a belt

评论概述: I ordered 32W x 32L - I received 38W x 30L. How does that happen?
评论详情: These pants appear to be very well made, and very feature rich. I was looking forward to no longer needing a tool belt, I couldn't wear them because the size differed so much from what I ordered. I've returned them and ordered a 30W x 30L (Amazon recommended 32W x 32L). I'm hoping to receive the size I actually ordered. Edit: 7/6/24 I actually received a 30W x 30L pair within two days. Now that I own a pair that I can actually wear, I have to say that these are an excellent pair of work pants. I only wear a leather tool belt now when I need something to clip an impact driver to. Amazon recommended 32W x 32L, but the 30W x 30L fits me perfectly. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because of the first shipment being so far off, and because of Amazon's return process. It was recommended that I take the package to return to a "UPS Store" with only a QR Code, and that it would be free. The first "UPS Store" I took it to told me they didn't process QR Codes at all, and the second one wanted to charge me $5 to scan a QR code and print the label. It is misleading for Amazon to recommend the QR Code return method as "free"!

评论概述: Great, runs small. Material is stiff
评论详情: They are great pants, well made. They are a little stiff when moving around, I think they are a little tight compared to other brands I wear of the same measurements. May or may not be the same for you.
Great work pants!! Very durable.pockets hold tools In  Place. Heavy-duty, fit good.

Best pants ever.  Last pair 20 yrs old…still in great condition.

评论概述: Very disappointed. The crotch already tore out.
评论详情: I had these pants less than a year and the crotch has already blow out. I have other Blaklader x1600 carpenter pants and Carhartt canvas pants that I wear on a rotational basis. I wear long pants only during the cold weather months. I am a contractor and rely on tough rugged work wear. I am very disappointed. These pants are very expensive.

评论概述: Tight fit, not enough rise, zipper needs to go downwards further
评论详情: I bought a 32 but it was too loose around the waist.  The 30 is too tight in the hips & both need to have a higher rise - they are too tight in the crotch.I like the nail/tool pockets that you can tuck in when not being used.  The zipper pocket on the left needs to be an inch taller to fit a traditional tall billfold or I suppose a digital device.  There should be Cordura at the top of the nail pockets, so you can clip a knife or ruler without eventually tearing the fabric.  I like the pencil pockets on both sides since I might be holding a workpiece with either hand & need to scribe a line.

The pants are amazing but this is the second pair I bought within a year. The crotch was out within 5 to 6 months for what I pay for these pants I figure it should at least last a year. I'd buy Carpenter wranglers for 20 bucks I could actually buy six pairs and would last me way more than a year I actually have wranglers that I've had for the last 3 to 4 years.. they need to reinforce the crotch because the construction you're doing a lot of bending and walking

I normally wear a 36  waist..so I bought a 36 and they fit perfectly until I washed them the first time.. I guess I shouldn’t of put them in the dryer because they shrank so much that they didn’t fit so then I returned them and tried a 38 which was just way too large now I have this $150 pair of way too large pants..

评论概述: Comfortable right out of the package.
评论详情: These are well made work pants. I thought all the pockets were overkill and wish the made a simpler pant. There’s one pocket that sticks out on the left, it seemed like an afterthought.

I got these pants within the last 3-3.5 weeks and a zipper has already broken off. The little tab part and the top that holds the tab on. I have no idea when or how as its a pocket I haven't  had a use for but im extremely  unimpressed for the price i paid. I wil not be buying from this brand again, which is a shame because i love the pockets. Also im left handed and the hoop is only on the right side. I can put my knife on the top left outter pocket but  that puts the knife in my stomach  (and im skinny) when i bend over.
Got these for my son for Christmas. This is his second pair in five years. The previous pair still in good shape; he needed a bigger size after 5 years. He is giving his son the other pair.

I bought a pair of the painter pants on sale just to introduce myself to the expensive world of Blakladders. The painter pants held up extremely well over 9 months and I absolutely loved the built in knee pad pocket. Its been a game changer not having to constantly remember to grab knee pads or a kneeling pad from my truck. If you're doing a floor installation get your kneepads. They're not great all day long, but here and there the little cushion on the knees saves me.  Now I just bought the x1600s and I think they're great, maybe not worth TWICE as much as the painters pants, but they're still really good.  The main reason I bought these was for working in finished homes around clients furniture. If you're working in a finished house and want to have more hand tools on your person, or need 2/3 pockets with different size screws, then these pants are where it's at! You don't have to worry about scraping cabinets with your bulky tool bag. Obviously you can't carry everything from your tool bag but the extra pockets and pouches can really make your day go smoother.  One thing to consider is they're hot! Extremely comfortable in Colorado winters, but I wouldn't recommend them for summer work.

I've tried lots of high end work pants including Carhartt, Helly Hansen, TruWork, and Caterpillar. No doubt these are the best. Very heavy construction. Really like the cell pocket on the right thigh and the parts pockets that can be tucked away when not needed. The cordova is very tough. Also like the all black that don't show stains and dirt.
Been wearing these pants for more than 3 years. By far the best pants ever. Strong and warm. I highly suggest it to everyone in construction.

Expensive... But probably worth every penny. Excellent soil resistance. Does not shrink very much. 32-30 was true to size. I would swear one leg is an inch longer than the other? And I have 3 pairs so it's a more valid observation! Have not actually measured... But it really sticks out standing in front of a full length mirror,
I’m a carpenter and these are the best pants you will ever find. High quality. I’ve recommended these to friends, and they love em too.

评论概述: These are really solid quality - The stitching and reinforcement is great.
评论详情: The belt loops fit none of my belt buckles.  I spent over 20 minutes fumble-f***ing my low profile clip-in belt through.  Granted, these loops won't be breaking any time soon but they were 1/8" too small for the smallest buckle and more for every other I have.  I'm not sure which buckle these are designed for but I guess I'll be shopping for one after writing this.They're probably a bit too heavy to wear if you're working in 90+ degrees, they are by no means the worst but if you're working outside in extreme heat, these aren't it for that.  I work in and around a theater building mostly on HVAC - while it does get warm in those spaces it's not the same as construction work outside, I'm mostly stationary and these can be mildly uncomfortable for non-AC areas.

I cannot say enough good about these pants!!! Phenomenal!!!! They are my new favorite and this is the first of many I will be buying. I’ll never buy any other brand of pants for work. The fit is great, they don’t slowly creep down the backside as the day goes, the materials are very flexible and move well with my body. The pockets are convenient and even while carrying a bunch I hardly noticed. And to top it all off they look amazing, it’s an absolute flex to wear these on the job site!! You cannot go wrong with these pants!
Great pants! Too much to say about them, just buy them.

Everything else is perfect.  Fit great.  Great pockets and kneepads.  But these guys really need to address this.  Quick browse through the reviews reveals others with the same problem.  They wouldnt do anything for their so called lifetime warranty.  Im upset cause i thought i finally found decent work pants.  Im gonna fix this and try catapiller or workman... Idk.  No one makes anything good anymoreEdit: i should add this happened after only a couple months.  I dont expect anything to last forever but these are supposed to be top of the line and walmart pants last longer

I loved these work pants but lasting 6 months I don't think I'll be buying them again.  (I'll add pictures later today as I'm currently wearing them.)

评论概述: A little pricey but worth it.

评论概述: Work belt and Pants all in one, even with built in knee pads.  Strong fabric, great for tradesmen.
评论详情: I will start with I own 3 sets of "Blåkläder 2650-1370 Sleeveless Overalls" and they are 100% the best work attire I have ever worked in.  BUT! they are not sold in the states.  New job has a "uniform requirement" that includes black pants. So, as much as I want to I can't use those overalls, but I found these black pants.  NOTE the cut is not a "Relaxed fit cut" like most US jeans so buy larger and use a belt if you need too.  These do allow you pretty much a always attached tool belt, so if your like me and never set tools down (when ya do you lose them) these are great.  Main negative is that if you have big thighs like me, the side pockets are attached completely and I blew it out by having my large wallet in the pocket when I crouched down to lift a toilet. But even minus the one pocket there are still more then on any other work pants I've had.  The material is thick and durable and the seams strong. insertable knee pads are great and I hate when I wear pants that don't have the pockets for the kneepads. They are sold separately and you can get any brand of the insertable knee pads not just blaklader's ones. Moral of the story, if your in the US and looking for a great pair of work pants that include a tool belt I can't recommend a better product. If your in europe? Blåkläder 2650-1370 Sleeveless Overalls is far superior.

Great work pant.

评论概述: The best work pants I've ever owned, no question.
评论详情: Exactly as advertised, these pants were obviously designed with serious construction work in mind. Absolutely worth spending the extra money for these over any other work pants.  Ive never been more happy with any purchase.  I work, a lot, and my work gear gets some serious wear and tear. These pants hold up to everything I could put them through, and they're extremely comfortable.  They fit exactly right, to the point that I don't even need to wear a belt, which makes wearing my tool belt with these pants even more comfortable.  Usually I'm not a fan of built in tool pouches because I rarely use them, but the design of these built in pouches is beyond perfect. If you don't want to use the pouches, they tuck inside of the pants and actually provide additional cushioning on my hip bones, exactly where my hips usually get sore from the weight of my huge tool belt all day long. On most other work pants with built in pouches, I just cut them off as I never use them over my tool belt. With these pants, I love that they're there, tucked into the pants and adding extra cushioning. Whoever designed these pants really thought of everything.  So many zippered pockets, loops, and pouches, I easily and safely carry my phone, vape, painkillers, putty knife, and utility blade.  I love the zippered pockets for my phone and vape especially. I used to leave them in my vehicle as they would always get covered in sawdust, dirt, and other debris. Vaping sawdust sucks. But with the huge zippered pockets, my vape easily fits inside and never gets any sawdust or debris in it.  These pants just FEEL serious. The material is incredibly resilient and sturdy. Whenever I put these on I feel like I'm putting on a suit of armor. My boss and anyone else I work with have been real impressed with all the features, and at least two of my coworkers are ordering a pair of these after seeing me wear mine.  They also look awesome. They form to my body perfectly, never feel like they get in the way. Some work pants just feel too baggy, reducing my mobility. Not these. They are heavy duty pants but I feel agile and mobile whenever I wear them.  The kneepad pocket design is different than what I'm used to. Usually you insert kneepad from the top, and then velcro the pocket shut. With these pants, the Blacklader Kneepads (which are not included, and are much larger than most traditional kneepad inserts. Highly recommend those as well) fit VERY snuggly inside the kneepad pockets, but are inserted from the bottom. Then there is a small lip inside the pocket that the bottom of the kneepad sits on top of. No velcro, buttons, or zippers, and it's a TIGHT fit. Took me fifteen minutes to actually get the Kneepads to fit in properly, but once they are in, they don't move or slide around like most other kneepad inserts I've used. And they are big. Longer than traditional Kneepads, they protect most of my shin and my knees. They were difficult enough to get in that I don't even bother removing them, I just wash the pants with the Kneepads in the pockets. It's tricky to get them in, but completely worth it once you've got it.  I can't recommend these pants enough. If you've ever been on the fence about spending a bit more for Blacklader pants, all I can say is, you should buy these. You will not regret it.  Ill be ordering another pair soon, eventually I'd like all of my work pants to be Blacklader.
They are great so far. They seem durable but we will see how they hold up.
